title: SAGE: Sample-Aware Guarding Engine for Robust Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
authors: Jing Chen, Onat Gungor, Zhengli Shang, and Tajana Rosing
venue: IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics and Security (TIFS)
abstract: Proposed SAGE, a sample-aware defense engine that integrates active learning with targeted data reduction to select the most effective defense against adversarial attacks in ML-based intrusion detection. Built a two-level defense selection pipeline that identifies highly informative samples and generates optimal defense labels for training a second-stage meta-learner. Achieved up to 201% F1-score improvement over state-of-the-art defenses across multiple IoT IDS datasets while reducing computational cost by up to 29× and narrowing the gap to the Oracle to just 3.8%.

title: CITADEL: Continual Anomaly Detection for Enhanced Learning in IoT Intrusion Detection
authors: Elvin Li, Onat Gungor, Zhengli Shang, and Tajana Rosing
abstract: Developed a self-supervised continual learning framework for IoT intrusion detection that learns robust benign traffic representations while retaining long term knowledge via optimized memory consolidation. Integrated a tabular to image transformation module and a memory aware masked autoencoder (MAE) to enable anomaly detection without labeled attack data. Designed a novelty detection component to adapt to emerging cyber threats while retaining detection of known attacks, achieving up to 72.9% improvement over a VAE based lifelong anomaly detector (VLAD) on multiple IoT datasets.

title: DYNAMITE: Dynamic Defense Selection for Enhancing Machine Learning-based Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
authors: Jing Chen, Onat Gungor, Zhengli Shang, Elvin Li, and Tajana Rosing
venue: IEEE/ACM Workshop on the Internet of Safe Things
abstract: Developed DYNAMITE framework adaptively selecting most effective defenses against diverse adversarial attacks in real-time. Implemented adversarial attack generation and integrated nine state-of-the-art defenses with XGBoost-based dynamic assignment. Achieved 76.7% F1-score improvement over random defense with 96.2% computational cost reduction.

title: SAFE: Self-Supervised Anomaly Detection Framework for Intrusion Detection
authors: Elvin Li, Zhengli Shang, Onat Gungor, and Tajana Rosing
venue: AAAI Workshop on AI for Cyber Security (AICS)
abstract: Proposed SAFE framework transforming tabular network traffic into image-like representations for robust feature learning with MAEs. Developed lightweight novelty detection module leveraging MAE-extracted representations to detect unknown and evolving cyber threats without labeled data. Achieved 26.2% F1-score improvement over SLAD and 23.5% improvement over Anomal-E across multiple IoT datasets.

title: Rigorous Evaluation of Machine Learning-Based Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
authors: Onat Gungor, Elvin Li, Zhengli Shang, Yutong Guo, Jing Chen, Johnathan Davis, and Tajana Rosing
venue: IEEE Conference on Cybersecurity and Resilience (CSR)
abstract: Developed comprehensive evaluation framework benchmarking ML-based IoT IDS against white-box, gray-box, and black-box adversarial attacks. Evaluated state-of-the-art ML/DL models across four IoT datasets using gradient-based, optimization-based, and transfer-based attack methods. Revealed severe vulnerabilities with IDS performance degrading up to 49.5× under adversarial perturbations.
